2117460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117460
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 001
2117460.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A Muslim has six duties towards other Muslims: When you meet him, you should salute him; when he invites you, accept his invitation; when he asks for your advice, give it to him; when he sneezes and praises Allah, say May Allah have mercy on you; when he is ill, visit him; and when he dies follow his funeral.” Related by Muslim.

2117470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117470
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 002
2117470.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Look at those who are lower than you (financially) but do not look at those who are higher than you, lest you belittle the favors Allah conferred upon you.” Agreed upon.

2117480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117480
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 003
2117480.text: An-Nawwas bin Sam'an (RAA) narrated, ‘I asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about virtue and sin and he replied, “The essence of virtue is (manifested in) good morals (Akhlaq) whereas sinful conduct is that which turns in your heart (making you feel uncomfortable) and you dislike that it would be disclosed to other people.” Related by Muslim.

2117490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117490
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 004
2117490.text: Ibn Mas’ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When three of you get together in company, two of you must not talk privately while isolating the third, so as not to make him feel sad (that he is left out) till you mingle with other people (i.e. you are joined by others).” Agreed upon and the wording is from Muslim.

2117500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117500
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 005
2117500.text: Ibn Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A man should not ask another man to get up from his place in order to take his seat. But you should make room for each other and spread out.” Agreed upon.

2117510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117510
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 006
2117510.text: Ibn Abbas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When one of you eats, he must not wipe his hand till he licks it, or gives it to someone else to lick (such as a wife, husband, etc.).” Agreed upon.

2117520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117520
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 007
2117520.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The young should salute the old, the one who is passing by should salute the one who is sitting, and the small group of people should salute the larger one.” Agreed upon.

2117530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117530
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 008
2117530.text: In a version by Muslim, “And the one who is riding should salute the one who is walking.”

2117540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117540
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 009
2117540.text: Ali (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When a group of people passes by, it is sufficient if one of them gives a salutation, and it is sufficient for those who are sitting that one of them replies.” Related by Ahmad and Al-Baihaqi.

2117550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117550
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 010
2117550.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Do not initiate the saluting of Jews and Christians (when you meet them), and if you meet any of them on the road, force him to go to the narrowest part of the road (i.e. do not give way for them to pass, but keep going). Related by Muslim.

2117560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117560
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 011
2117560.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When one of you sneezes, he should say, ‘Alhamdulillah (Praise is to Allah) and his (Muslim) brother should say to him, ‘Yarhamuka Allah (May Allah have mercy on you). When he says this to him (the last phrase), he should reply, ‘Yahdikum Allah (May Allah guide you) and grant you well being.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2117570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117570
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 012
2117570.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “None of you should drink while standing.” Related by Muslim.

2117580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117580
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 013
2117580.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When one of you puts on his shoes, he should put on the right one first and when he takes them off, he should take off the left one first, so that the right one should be the first to be put on and the last to be taken off.” Agreed upon.

2117590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117590
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 014
2117590.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “None of you should walk with one shoe, but should either wear them both or take them both off” Agreed upon.

2117600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117600
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 015
2117600.text: Ibn Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah will not look on the Day of Judgment at him who lets his garment drag on the ground out of pride and arrogance.” Agreed upon.

2117610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117610
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 016
2117610.text: Ibn Umar narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When one of you eats he should eat with his right hand, and when he drinks he should drink with his right hand, for the devil eats and drinks with his left hand.” Related by Muslim.

2117620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117620
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 017
2117620.text: Amro bin Shu’aib narrated on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather (RAA), that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Eat, drink, wear clothes and give sadaqah but with neither extravagance nor pride.” Related by Abu Dawud and Ahmad.

2117630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117630
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 018
2117630.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “He who wishes to have his earnings grow (and be blessed) and his term of life prolonged, he should keep ties with his kin” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2117640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117640
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 019
2117640.text: Jubair bin Mut'am (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The one who severs the ties of kinship will not enter Paradise.” Agreed upon.

2117650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117650
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 020
2117650.text: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah has made it prohibited for you to be disrespectful (showing undutiful behavior) to your mothers, to bury your daughters alive, to refuse others (their dues), and to demand things from others (which are not worth demanding), and He hates that you engage in gossip, asking many questions about people’s affairs and wasting wealth.” Agreed upon.

2117660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117660
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 021
2117660.text: 'Abdullah bin 'Amro bin al-As (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah’s pleasure results from the parent’s pleasure, and Allah’s displeasure results from the parent’s displeasure.” Related by At-Tirmidhi. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2117670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117670
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 022
2117670.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “By Him in Whose Hand my soul is, a slave of Allah does not truly believe till he wishes for his neighbor what he wishes for himself.” Agreed upon.

2117680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117680
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 023
2117680.text: Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) narrated, ‘l asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) “Which sin is the most serious?” He replied, attribute a partner to Allah, though He Alone has created you. “I asked, “What next?” He said, kill your child, fearing that he will share your food with you.” I asked again, “What next?” He said, “To commit adultery with your neighbor’s wife.” Agreed upon.

2117690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117690
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 024
2117690.text: 'Abdullah bin 'Amro bin al-As (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “For a man to insult his parents, is one of the major sins.” It was asked, ‘Does a man insult his parents?’ He replied “Yes, he insults the father of a man who in return insults his father, and he insults a man’s mother who in return insult his.” Agreed upon.

2117700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117700
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 025
2117700.text: Abu Aiyub (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “It is not permissible for a Muslim to shun his brother for more than three nights. When they meet, this one turns away (from that one) and that one turns away (from this one) and the best of them is the one who greets his brother first.” Agreed upon

2117710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117710
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 026
2117710.text: Jabir bin ’Abdullah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Every act of goodness is (considered as) Sadaqah.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2117720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117720
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 027
2117720.text: Abu Dharr (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Do not consider any act of goodness as being insignificant even if it is meeting your brother with a cheerful face.” Related by Muslim.

2117730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117730
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 028
2117730.text: Abu Dharr (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When you make some soup, make a good amount by adding plenty of liquid, and give some to your neighbors.” Related by Muslim.

2117740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117740
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 029
2117740.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If anyone relieves a Muslim believer from one of the hardships of this worldly life, Allah will relieve him of one of the hardships of the Day of Resurrection. If anyone makes it easy for the one who is indebted to him (while finding it difficult to repay), Allah will make it easy for him in this worldly life and in the Hereafter, and if anyone conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults in this world and in the Hereafter. Allah helps His slave as long as he helps his brother.” Related by Muslim.

2117750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117750
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 030
2117750.text: Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “He who guides (others) to an act of goodness, will have a reward similar to that of its doer.” Related by Muslim.

2117760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117760
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 031
2117760.text: Ibn Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If anyone seeks refuge in Allah’s name, grant him protection; if anyone asks you for something in Allah’s name give him something; and if anyone does you a favor recompense him, but if you do not have the means to do so, make Dua (supplication) for him.” Related by Al-Baihaqi.

2117770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117770
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 032
2117770.text: An-Nu’man bin Bashir (RAA) narrated, I heard Allah‘s Messenger (ﷺ) saying, (Nu'man pointed with his two fingers to his ears) ‘Both lawful (Halal) and unlawful things (Haram) are evident but in between them there are doubtful things·and most people have no knowledge about them. So he, who saves himself from these doubtful things, saves his religion and his honor (i.e. keeps them blameless). And he who indulges in these doubtful things is like a shepherd who pastures (his animals) near the Hima (private pasture) of someone else and at any moment he is liable to get in it. (O people!) Beware! Every king has a Hima and the Hima of Allah on the earth is what He declared unlawful (Haram). Beware In the body there is a piece of flesh if it becomes sound and healthy, the whole body becomes sound and healthy but if it gets spoilt, the whole body gets spoilt and that is the heart.” Agreed upon.

2117780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117780
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 033
2117780.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Cursed is he, who is the slave of the Dinar, the slave of the Dirham, and the slave of the cloak bordered with silk. If he is given anything he would be satisfied, but if he is not given anything he is displeased.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2117790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117790
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 034
2117790.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) took hold of my shoulders and said, “Be in this world as though you were a stranger or a passerby.” Ibn ’Umar used to say, “If you are alive in the evening, do not expect to be alive till the morning and if you are alive in the morning do not expect to be alive till the evening, and take from your health for your sickness, and from your life for your death.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2117800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117800
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 035
2117800.text: Ibn ’Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “He who imitates any people (in their actions) is considered to be one of them.” Related by Abu Dawud and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih.

2117810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117810
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 036
2117810.text: Ibn 'Abbas (RAA) narrated, ‘One day I was riding behind the Prophet when he said, “O lad, be mindful of Allah and He will protect you. Be mindful of Allah and you shall find Him with you. When you ask (for anything), ask it from Allah, and if you seek help, seek help from Allah.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who verified it as Hasan and Sahih.

2117820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117820
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 037
2117820.text: Sahl bin Sa'd (RAA) narrated, A man came to the Prophet and said, “O Allah`s Messenger (ﷺ), direct me to a deed which if I do it, I shall be loved by Allah and by people.” He replied, “If you practice abstinence in this world, Allah will love you, and if you abstain from (desiring) what people have, they will love you.” Related by Ibn Majah and others with a good chain of narrators.

2117830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117830
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 038
2117830.text: Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (RAA) narrated, ‘l heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, “Allah loves the pious rich maxim who is inconspicuous (free from showing off or hypocrisy).” Related by Muslim.

2117840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117840
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 039
2117840.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A sign of man's good observance of Islam (his piety) is to keep away from that which does not concern him.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it as Hadith Hasan.

2117850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117850
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 040
2117850.text: Al-Miqdam bin Ma’diakrib (RAA), narrated that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: “A human being has never filled any vessel which is worse than his own belly.” Related by At-Tirmidhi, who graded it to be Hasan.

2117860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117860
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 041
2117860.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: “All the sons of Adam are sinners, but the best of sinners are those who repent often.” Related by At·Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah with a strong chain of narrators.

2117870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117870
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 042
2117870.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: “Keeping silent is considered as (an act of`) wisdom, but very few practice it.” Related by Al-Baihaqi in his book Shu'ab al-Iman with a weak chain of narrators a he deemed the sound view is that it is traced back to one of the companions who quoted it from Luqman Al-Hakim.

2117890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117890
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 043
2117890.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said: “Avoid envy, for envy devours good deeds just as fire devours firewood.” Related by Abu Dawud.

2117900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117900
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 044
2117900.text: Ibn Majah related a similar hadith on the authority of Anas.

2117910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117910
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 045
2117910.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: “The strong man is not the good wrestler; but the strong man is he who controls himself when he is angry.” Agreed upon.

2117920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117920
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 046
2117920.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Oppression will turn into darkness on the Day of Resurrection.” Agreed upon.

2117930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117930
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 047
2117930.text: Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Beware of oppression, for oppression will turn into excessive darkness on the Day of Resurrection and beware of niggardliness, for niggardliness destroyed your predecessors.” Related by Muslim.

2117940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117940
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 048
2117940.text: Mahmud bin Labid (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The thing I fear most for you is the lesser shirk (polytheism), showing-off (of good deeds).” Related by Ahmad with a good chain of narrators,

2117950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117950
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 049
2117950.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “There are three signs of a hypocrite: when he speaks, he tells lies; when he makes a promise, he breaks it; and when he is entrusted, he betrays his trust.” Agreed upon.

2117960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117960
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 050
2117960.text: Al·Bukhari and Muslim reported another hadith on the authority of ’Abdullah bin ’Umar (RAA) with the addition, “and when he quarrels, he is abusive (behaves in a very impudent and insulting manner).”

2117970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117970
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 051
2117970.text: Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: insulting a Muslim is disobedience to Allah, and fighting with him is Kufr (disbelief).” Agreed upon.

2117980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117980
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 052
2117980.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Avoid suspicion, for suspicion is the most false form of talk.” Agreed upon.

2117990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2117990
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 053
2117990.text: Ma'qil bin Yasar (RAA) narrated, ‘I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, “Any governor in charge of Muslim subjects who dies while acting dishonestly towards them will be excluded by Allah from Paradise.” Agreed upon.

2118000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118000
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 054
2118000.text: ‘A’ishah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “O Allah, cause distress to him who has any charge over my people and causes them distress.” Related by Muslim.

2118010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118010
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 055
2118010.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When any of you fights, he must avoid (striking) the face.” Agreed upon.

2118020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118020
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 056
2118020.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated, ‘A man said, “O Messenger of Allah, advise me.” The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Do not get angry.” The man repeated that several times and he replied, “Do not get angry.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2118030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118030
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 057
2118030.text: Khawlah al-Ansariyah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Some men acquire Allah’s Property (such as the funds of the Muslim state treasury, Zakah etc.) and they will go to Hell on the Day of Resurrection.” Related Al-Bukhari.

2118040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118040
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 058
2118040.text: Abu Dharr (RAA) quoted the Prophet (ﷺ) saying among what he narrated from Allah, the Most High that He has said, “O MY slaves, I have made oppression unlawful for myself and I have made it unlawful among you, so do not oppress one another.” Related by Muslim.

2118050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118050
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 059
2118050.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) asked, “Do you know what backbiting is?” They replied, `Allah and His Messenger (ﷺ) know best.’ He said, “It is saying something about your brother which he dislikes.” Someone asked, ‘Supposing that what I said about my brother was true?’ and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If what you say about him is true you have backbitten him and if it is not true you have slandered him.” Related by Muslim.

2118100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118100
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 060
2118100.text: Abu Hurairah [RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Avoid jealousy between yourselves, do not outbid one another (with a view to raising the price), do not harbor hatred against one another, do not bear enmity against one another, one of you should not enter into a transaction when the other has already entered into it; and be fellow brothers and slaves of Allah. A Muslim is a Muslim’s brother. He does not wrong, desert or despise him. Piety is found here (pointing three times to his chest), despising his Muslim brother is enough evil for any man to do. Every Muslim’s blood, property and honor are unlawful to be violated by another Muslim.” Related by Muslim.

2118110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118110
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 061
2118110.text: Qutbah bin Malik (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say, “O Allah, I seek refuge in you from evil morals, deeds, passions and diseases.” Related by At-Tirmidhi. Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih and it is his version.

2118120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118120
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 062
2118120.text: Ibn ’Abbas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Don’t dispute with your brother; don’t make jokes with him; and don’t make him a promise which you would break.” Related by At-Tirmidhi with a weak chain of narrators.

2118130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118130
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 063
2118130.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RAA), narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “There are two characteristics which are not combined in a believer; miserliness and bad morals.” Related by At-Tirmidhi with a weakness in its chain of narrators.

2118140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118140
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 064
2118140.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When two men insult one another, what they say is mainly the fault of the one who began it, so long as the one who is oppressed does not transgress.” Related by Muslim.

2118150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118150
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 065
2118150.text: Abu Sirmah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “He who causes harm to a Muslim will be harmed by Allah, and he who acts in a hostile manner against a Muslim, will be punished in the same way by Allah.” Related by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi who graded it to be Hasan (good).

2118160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118160
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 066
2118160.text: Abu ad-Darda (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah hates the profligate and the obscene.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it to be Sahih.

2118170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118170
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 067
2118170.text: At-Tirmidhi also related on the authority of Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The believer is not a slanderer, nor does he curse others, and nor is he immoral or shameless.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it to be Hasan. Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih and Ad-Daraqutni said that it is most probably Mawquf (traced only to a Companion).

2118180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118180
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 068
2118180.text: A’ishah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Avoid reviling the dead, they have already seen the result of (the deeds) that they forwarded before them.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2118190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118190
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 069
2118190.text: Hudhaifah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A backbiter will not enter Paradise.” Agreed upon.

2118200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118200
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 070
2118200.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If one restrained his anger, Allah will keep His punishment from him (on the Day of Resurrection).” Related by At-Tabarani in al-Awsat.

2118210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118210
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 071
2118210.text: The aforementioned hadith is supported by a narration on the authority of Ibn ’Umar related by Ibn Abi Ad-Dunia.

2118220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118220
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 072
2118220.text: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A crafty person, a miser and one who badly treats those under his authority will not enter Paradise.” Related by At-Tirmidhi in two separate traditions and there is a weakness in its chain of narrators.

2118230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118230
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 073
2118230.text: Ibn ’Abbas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If anyone listened to the talk of some people, when they do not like him to do that, then molten led will be poured into his ears on the Day of Resurrection.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2118240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118240
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 074
2118240.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Blessed is he who is preoccupied with his defects rather than those of other people.” Related by Al-Bazzar with a good chain of narrators.

2118250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118250
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 075
2118250.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever exalts himself and walks proudly; Allah will be angry with him when he meets Him (on the Day of Resurrection).” Related Al-Hakim with a reliable chain of narrators.

2118260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118260
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 076
2118260.text: Sahl bin Sa’d (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Haste comes from Satan.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded is as Hasan.

2118270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118270
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 077
2118270.text: 'A'ishah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Pessimism is part of bad character.” Related by Ahmad with a weak chain of narrators.

2118280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118280
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 078
2118280.text: Abu ad-Darda’ (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Men accustomed to cursing will not be intercessors or witnesses on the Day of Resurrection.” Related by Muslim.

2118290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118290
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 079
2118290.text: Mu'adh bin Jabal (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If anyone disgraces his brother for a sin, he will not die before committing it himself.” Related At-Tirmidhi who graded it to be Hasan.

2118300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118300
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 080
2118300.text: Bahz bin Hakim narrated on the authority of his father, on the authority of his grandfather (RAA) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Woe to him who lies in his talk to make the people laugh, Woe to him! Woe to him!” Related by the three Imams with a strong chain of narrators.

2118310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118310
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 081
2118310.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The atonement of backbiting a man is to ask Allah to forgive him.” Related by Al-Harith bin Abu Usamah with a weak chain of narrators.

2118320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118320
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 082
2118320.text: 'A’ishah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The most despicable amongst people in the sight of Allah is the ruthless argumentative (person).” Related by Muslim.

2118330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118330
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 083
2118330.text: Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Adhere (you people) to truth, for truth leads to good deeds and good deeds lead to Paradise, and if a man continues to speak the truth and makes truth his object he will be recorded as truthful before Allah. Avoid (you people) falsehood, for falsehood leads to wickedness and wickedness leads to Hell, and if a man continues to speak falsehood and makes falsehood his object he will be recorded as a liar before Allah.” Agreed upon.

2118340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118340
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 084
2118340.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Beware of suspicion, for suspicion amounts to the worst form of lying.” Agreed upon.

2118350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118350
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 085
2118350.text: Abu Said al-Khudri (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Avoid sitting by the road side.” The people then said, ‘O Allah‘s Messenger (ﷺ), we cannot do without those meeting places in which we converse” So he said, “Well, if you insist (on that) give the road its due rights.” They asked, ‘What are the road’s due rights?’ He replied, “Lowering your gaze, abstaining from anything offensive, returning salutations, enjoining the right (Ma'ruf) and forbidding from evil deeds (Munkar).” Agreed upon.

2118400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118400
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 086
2118400.text: Mu’awiyah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “When Allah wishes good for anyone, He bestows upon him the Fiqh (comprehension) of the religion.” Agreed upon.

2118410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118410
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 087
2118410.text: Abu ad-Darda’ (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The heaviest thing which will be put on the believer’s scale (on the Day of Resurrection) will be good morals.” Related by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi who graded it as Sahih.

2118420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118420
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 088
2118420.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Haya (modesty, bashfulness etc.) is a part of Faith.” Agreed upon.

2118430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118430
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 089
2118430.text: Ibn Mas’ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “One of the things people have learned from the words of the earliest prophecies is, “If you don’t feel any shame, do whatever you like.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2118440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118440
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 090
2118440.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A believer who is strong (and healthy) is better and dearer to Allah than the weak believer, but there is goodness in both of them. Be keen on what benefits you and seek help from Allah, and do not give up. If anything afflicts you do not say, ‘If I had done such and such things, such and such would have happened.’ But say, ‘Allah decrees and what He wills He does,’ for (the utterance) ‘If I had’ provides an opening for the deeds of the devil.” Related by Muslim.

2118450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118450
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 091
2118450.text: ’Iyad bin Himar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah, the Most High has revealed to me that you (people) should be humble, so that no one transgresses another, or boasts to the other.” Related by Muslim.

2118460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118460
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 092
2118460.text: Abu ad-Darda’ (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If a Muslim defends his brother’s honor in his absence, Allah will protect his face from the fire of Hell on the Day of Resurrection.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it to be Hasan.

2118470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118470
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 093
2118470.text: Ahmad related a similar hadith on the authority of Asma the daughter of Yazid.

2118480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118480
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 094
2118480.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Sadaqah does not decrease property and Allah increases the honor of him who forgives and no one will humble himself for Allah’s sake except that Allah raises his status.” Related by Muslim.

2118490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118490
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 095
2118490.text: 'Abdullah bin Salam (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “O people, extend greetings (saying Salam to each other), keep relations with your kin, provide food (to people) and pray at night when people are asleep and you will enter Paradise in peace.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it as Sahih.

2118500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118500
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 096
2118500.text: Tamim ad-Dari (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The religion is Nasihah.” the people said, ‘To whom should it be directed?’ He replied, “To Allah, His Book, His Messenger (ﷺ), to the leaders of the Muslims and to the common folk of the Muslims.” Related by Muslim.

2118510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118510
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 097
2118510.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The fear of Allah and good morals (Akhlaq) are the two major characteristics which lead to Paradise.” Related by At-Tirmidhi and Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2118520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118520
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 098
2118520.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “You (people) cannot satisfy people with your wealth, but satisfy them with your cheerful faces and good morals.” Related by Abu Ya’la and Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2118530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118530
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 099
2118530.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Every believer is the mirror of his brother.” Related by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narrators.

2118540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118540
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 100
2118540.text: Ibn ’Umar (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A believer who mixes with people and endures their annoyance is better than the one who does not mix with them and does not endure their annoyance.” Related by Ibn Majah with a good chain of narrators. At-Tirmidhi reported the hadith without mentioning the Companion.

2118550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118550
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 101
2118550.text: Ibn Mas’ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) Said, “O Allah You have made my creation perfect, so make my moral characteristics also be the best.”

2118560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118560
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 102
2118560.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Allah, the Most High says: ‘l am with my slave when he remembers me and his lips move with my mention.” Related by Ibn Majah and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih.

2118570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118570
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 103
2118570.text: Mu’adh Ibn Jabal (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A man does nothing to rescue himself from Allah’s punishment better than remembering Allah.” Related by Ibn Abi Shaibah and At-Tabarani with a good chain of narrators.

2118580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118580
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 104
2118580.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “People will not sit in an assembly in which they remember Allah without the angels surrounding them, mercy covering them, and Allah mentioning them among those who are with Him.” Related by Muslim.

2118590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118590
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 105
2118590.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “If people sit in an assembly in which they do not remember Allah or invoke blessings on the Prophet it will be a cause of grief to them on the Day of Resurrection.” Related by At-Tirmidhi who graded it as Hasan.

2118600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118600
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 106
2118600.text: Abu Aiyub al-Ansari (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever says ten times: ‘None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise. He gives life and causes death. He is over all things, Omnipotent will have a reward equivalent to that of emancipating four of the descendants of lsma'il from slavery.” Agreed upon.

2118610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118610
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 107
2118610.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever says a hundred times, ‘How perfect Allah is and I praise Him,’ his sins will be forgiven though they may be as much as the foam of the sea.” Agreed upon.

2118620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118620
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 108
2118620.text: Juairiyah bint al-Harith (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me, “Since leaving you have said four phrases which if weighed against all you have said today, would prove to be heavier: ‘How perfect Allah is and I praise Him by the amount of His creation and His pleasure, and by the weight of His throne, and the ink of His words.” Related by Muslim.

2118630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118630
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 109
2118630.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The lasting good deeds are: (the saying of) ‘None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone, How perfect Allah is and Allah is great and all praise is for Allah, There is no might nor power except with Allah.” Related by An-Nasa’i. Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2118640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118640
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 110
2118640.text: Samurah bin Jundub (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The words dearer to Allah are four: ‘How perfect Allah is and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone and Allah is great It does not matter which you say first.” Related by Muslim.

2118650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118650
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 111
2118650.text: Abu Musa al-Ash'ari (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me, “O 'Abdullah bin Qais, would you like to be guided to one of the treasures of Paradise.” l here is no might nor power except with Allah.’ Agreed upon.

2118660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118660
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 112
2118660.text: An-Nasa’i added in his version, “there is no refuge from Allah except by turning to Him.’

2118670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118670
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 113
2118670.text: An-Nu’man bin al-Bashir (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Verily supplication is worship.” Related by the four Imams and At-Tirmidhi graded it as Sahih,

2118680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118680
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 114
2118680.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Supplication is the pith of worship.” Related by At-Tirmidhi with a full chain of narrators.

2118690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118690
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 115
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 115
2118690.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Nothing is more honorable before Allah than supplication.” Related by At-Tirmidhi with a full chain of narrators. Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih;.

2118700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118700
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 116
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 116
2118700.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “A supplication made between the Adhan and Iqamah is never rejected.” Related by An-Nasa’i and others, Ibn Hibban and others graded it as Sahih.

2118710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118710
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 117
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 117
2118710.text: Salman (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Your Rabb (Lord of the Universe) is Modest and Generous, and would never turn the hands of a slave without gain when he raises them to Him (in supplication).” Related by the four lmams except An-Nasa’i. Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2118720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118720
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 118
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 118
2118720.text: 'Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) raised his hands in supplication, he did not lower them till he wiped his face with them.’ Related by At-Tirmidhi.

2118730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118730
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 119
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 119
2118730.text: There are other traditions, which support this narration, of which is: The Hadith narrated by Ibn ’Abbas (RAA) related by Abu Dawud and others. Put together, they confirm that it is Hasan.

2118750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118750
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 120
2118750.text: Ibn Mas'ud (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Those who are nearest to me on the Day of Resurrection are those who invoke many blessings on me.” Related by At-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih.

2118760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118760
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 121
2118760.text: Shaddad bin Aus (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “The best manner of asking for forgiveness is to say: “O Allah! You are my Lord. None has the right to be worshipped except You. You created me and I am your servant and I abide by your covenant and promise as best I can. I seek refuge in you from the evil, which I have committed. I acknowledge your favor upon me and I acknowledge my sins, so forgive me, for verily none can forgive sin except you.” Related by Al-Bukhari.

2118770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118770
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 122
2118770.text: Ibn ’Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) never failed to say these words in the morning and the evening: “O Allah! I ask you for pardon and well-being in my religious and worldly affairs, and my family and my wealth. O Allah! Cover my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah! Preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I seek refuge with you lest I be swallowed up by the earth.” Related by An-Nasa’i and Ibn Majah. Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih.

2118780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118780
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 123
2118780.text: Ibn 'Umar (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to supplicate saying, “O Allah! I seek refuge in you from the withholding of your favor, the decline of the good health you have given, the suddenness of your vengeance and from all forms of your wrath.” Related by Muslim.

2118790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118790
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 124
2118790.text: Ibn Umar (RAA) narrated, “The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say, “O Allah! I seek refuge in you from the burden of debts and from being over-powered by men and from the gloating of enemies (at an evil I am afflicted with).” Related by

2118800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118800
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 125
2118800.text: Buraidah (RAA) narrated, ‘The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) heard a man saying: ‘O Allah! I ask you by virtue that I testify that you are Allah; there is no God but You, the one —· the Self Sufficient Master, Who did not beget, and was not begotten, and to whom no one is equal.’ Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) then said, “He has asked Allah by His Name by which when asked, He gives, and by which when supplicated, He answers.” Related by the four Imams and Ibn Hibban graded it as Sahih.

2118810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118810
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 126
2118810.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated, ‘Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) would say in the morning, “O Allah! By Your leave we have reached the morning and by your leave we have reached the evening. By Your leave we live and die. Unto you is our resurrection.” In the evening, he would say the same except the last phrase: “and to you do we return.” Related by the four Imams.

2118820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118820
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 127
2118820.text: Anas (RAA) narrated, “The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to supplicate frequently: “O our Lord, grants us the best in this life and the best in the next life, and protects us from the punishment of the Fire.” Agreed upon.

2118830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118830
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 128
2118830.text: Abu Musa al-Ash’ari (RAA) narrated, “The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to supplicate, “O Allah, forgive me my faults, my ignorance, my immoderation in my concern. And you are better aware (of my affairs) than myself. O Allah, grant me forgiveness (of the faults which I committed) seriously or otherwise (and which I committed) inadvertently and deliberately. All these (failings) are in me. O Allah, grant me forgiveness from the faults, which I did in haste or deferred, which I committed in privacy or in public and you are better aware (of them) than myself. You are the First and the Last and over all things you are Omnipotent.” Agreed Upon.

2118840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118840
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 129
2118840.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say, “O Allah! Set right for me my religion, which is the safeguard of my affairs. And set right for me the affairs of the world wherein is my living. Decree the Hereafter to be good for me. And make this life, for me, (a source) of abundance for every good and make my death (a source) of comfort to me and protection against every evil.” Related by Muslim.

2118850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118850
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 130
2118850.text: Anas (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say, “O Allah! Grant me benefit in what you have taught me, and teach me useful knowledge and provide me with knowledge that will benefit me.” Related by An-Nasa’i and Al-Hakim.

2118860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118860
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 131
2118860.text: At-Tirmidhi reported a similar tradition on the authority of `Abu Hurairah (RAA), he said at its end, “And increase my knowledge. Praise be to Allah in all circumstances. I seek refuge in Allah from the state of those who will go to Hell.” Its chain of narrators is good.

2118870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118870
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 132
2118870.text: ’A’ishah (RAA) narrated, ‘Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) taught her this supplication, “O Allah! I ask you of all good of what I have done and what I have not done in this world and in the Hereafter. I seek refuge in you from the evil of what I have done and what I have not done in this world and in the Hereafter. O Allah! I ask of you all good that your servant and Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) used to ask of you. I seek refuge in you from all evil that your servant and Prophet Muhammad used to seek refuge in you from. O Allah! I ask you for Paradise and what brings me nearer to it of deeds and sayings. I seek refuge in You from Hell-Fire and what brings me near to it of deeds and sayings. I ask you for the good consequences of Your Decree.” Related by Ibn Majah Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim graded it as Sahih

2118880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2118880
In-book reference  : Book 16, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 16, Hadith 133
2118880.text: Abu Hurairah (RAA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Two phrases which are dear to the Compassionate One and are light on the tongue but heavy in the scale are: “How perfect Allah is and I praise Him; and How perfect Allah is the Most Great.” Agreed upon.
